intro: Psychotria isanae, commonly known as the Isanae Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Psychotria isanae is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
